alert.note: Alert for Cottonwood; Jackson; Murray; Nobles; Pipestone; Rock (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Sioux Falls (Southeastern SD, Southwestern MN, and Northwestern IA)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 05 at 5:43PM CDT until July 05 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Sioux Falls
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTHWESTERN COTTONWOOD, WEST CENTRAL JACKSON, SOUTHERN MURRAY, NORTHERN NOBLES, SOUTHERN PIPESTONE, ROCK, SOUTHEASTERN MOODY AND NORTHEASTERN MINNEHAHA COUNTIES... At 543 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain in the warned area. Between 3 and 5 inches of rain have fallen across Rock County. Flash flooding is already occurring. Between 2 to 3 inches of rain has fallen across Nobles County with an additional 1 to 2 inches of rain possible. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Luverne, Slayton, Fulda, Adrian, Edgerton, Garretson, Valley Springs, Jasper, Brewster, Leota, Wilmont, Beaver Creek, Chandler, Lismore, Hardwick, Trosky, Sherman, Blue Mounds State Park, Palisades State Park and Magnolia. Numerous roads in and around Luverne are experiencing significant street flooding as reported by Emergency Management, including Blue Mound and Main Streets, and Highway 75 south of Luverne. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

area.areaDesc: Cottonwood; Jackson; Murray; Nobles; Pipestone; Rock
